thanks for the help

-dan

author: becker513

comments.content:
My eyes!

[http://www.fontscape.com/explore?8V4](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020180223/http:/www.fontscape.com/explore?8V4 "http://www.fontscape.com/explore?8V4")

Take a look at these pulled from previous thread. It resemples the ultra condensed face used on the bottom of movie posters.

I was going to suggest Monotype's Grotesque Extra Condensed that has been vertically stretched. It has the right G (which is very closed) and R, which are about the only semi-distinctive features of this typeface.

- Mike Yanega

Marc, which one of those has the G with a chin (or beard)? The first one doesn't.

- Mike Yanega
Excellent point, Mike. All of the Gs in the Font Bureau specimen book are chin/beardless.
This was designed by michael beruit...possible he would stretch that though?
